problems.title: Evaluate Boolean Expression with Multiple Operators
problems.description:
Given three boolean values (0 or 1) representing A, B, C, and an operator string ("AND", "OR", "XOR"), evaluate the expression.

If operator is:
- "AND": Evaluate A AND B AND C
- "OR": Evaluate A OR B OR C
- "XOR": Evaluate A XOR B XOR C

Print "true" if result is 1, else print "false".

Input Format:
First line: three integers (0 or 1) separated by space
Second line: operator string ("AND", "OR", or "XOR")

Output Format:
Print "true" or "false".
problems.examples:
Sample Input
1 1 0
AND

Sample Output
false

Sample Input
1 0 1
OR

Sample Output
true

Sample Input
1 0 1
XOR

Sample Output
false

Explanation:
Evaluate expression based on operator using nested conditions. XOR is true when odd number of 1s.
problems.constraints:
Each input is 0 or 1
Operator is one of: AND, OR, XOR
hintsList: Use nested if-else: if op == "AND", check if all are 1. If op == "OR", check if any is 1. If op == "XOR", check if count of 1s is odd.
